citations.narrative:
There were several areas of the facility in a state of disrepair.
In the camel enclosure, there were several detached wires protruding from the side of the barn. In the same enclosure,
the back wall of the shelter area has detached from the support posts. This wall separation caused an approximately 10"
gap at the base of the building and exposed several sharp nails at the level of the animals. The stalls in the shelter also
contained broken boards and other wood material on the ground.
Failure to maintain enclosure shelters can allow for gaps, unstable structures, or sharp points which can result in injury,
entrapment, or escape of the animals.
Facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain them.

There were a large number of flies in the three pig pens. Several flies were observed flying around the bedding and feed
areas of the enclosures. The facility has implemented various pest control measures, however, they do not appear to be
effective at this time.
Failure to maintain an effective insect control program can allow for the introduction and spread of disease hazards to the
animals.
The licensee must ensure that a safe and effective pest control program is established and maintained at the facility.
Correct by: July 15, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
There were several areas of the facility in a state of disrepair. 
In the camel enclosure, there were several detached wires protruding from the side of the barn. In the same enclosure, 
the back wall of the shelter area has detached from the support posts. This wall separation caused an approximately 10" 
gap at the base of the building and exposed several sharp nails at the level of the animals. The stalls in the shelter also 
contained broken boards and other wood material on the ground. 
Failure to maintain enclosure shelters can allow for gaps, unstable structures, or sharp points which can result in injury, 
entrapment, or escape of the animals. 
Facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain them. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
There were a large number of flies in the three pig pens. Several flies were observed flying around the bedding and feed 
areas of the enclosures. The facility has implemented various pest control measures, however, they do not appear to be 
effective at this time.  
Failure to maintain an effective insect control program can allow for the introduction and spread of disease hazards to the 
animals. 
The licensee must ensure that a safe and effective pest control program is established and maintained at the facility. 
Correct by: July 15, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
